title_sort: bethuel smith to walt whitman, 16 december 1863
title: Bethuel Smith to Walt Whitman, 16 December 1863
text: Dec the 16 1863Camp Near Culpeper VADear friendI now take this opertunity[opportunity] to write to you after so long A time. you must excuse me for not writing sooner for I cold not get anny[any] paper. I have received three letters from you since I wrote to you we have had pretty hard times this fall but we are having it easyer[easier] now we are doing provoprovost duty in Culpeper now but I dont[don't] now how long it will last there is some talk of braking up 4 Companies of the 2 Cav & I dont[don't] no but my Company will be one of them if it is we will go on recruiting servis[service] that will be A good jok[joke] but I dont[don't] now as that will be the Case yet still I hope soI am well & harty[hearty] & in good spirits I have not heard from home in A long time I gess[guess] that they have for got that they have A son in the armyit is about 2 O Clock at night now I am on gard[guard] sitting by A big fire you must excuse my writing with A pencil for I cannot get pen & ink to write with no more at present good by Directions the same Bethuel Smith to Walt Whitman, 16 December 1863
